bham.leakiest

Class Stats

  • java.lang.Object
    • bham.leakiest.Stats

  • public class Stats
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class that contains some general statistic methods.
    Version:
    1.4.5
    Author:
    Tom Chothia, Yusuke Kawamoto

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double chiSqu95Interval(int freedom)
      Returns the upper bound for the 95% confidence interval for the χ-squared distribution with n degrees of freedom.
      static double chiSquare(int[] observedCounts, double[] expectedCounts)
      Returns χ-square value given observed counts and expected counts.
      static double chiSquare(int[] observedCounts, int[] expectedCounts)
      Returns χ-square value given observed counts and expected counts.
      static double G(int[] observedCounts, double[] expectedCounts)
      Returns G value given observed counts and expected counts.
      static double lowerBoundNormal95(double mean, double variance)
      Calculates the lower bound for a 95% confidence interval for a normal distribution with given mean and variance i.e., the value above which 97.5% of sample take.
      static double lowerBoundNormal95Lower(double mean, double variance)
      Calculates the lower bound for a 95% confidence interval for a normal distribution with given mean and variance, upper only i.e., the value above which 95% of sample take.

      Rounds the double n to dp decimal places.

      Calculates the standard deviation for sampled data.

      Calculates the standard deviation for sampled data, using:
      s = sqrt( (Sigma_i (x_i - x)^2) / (n-1) )

      Calculates the upper bound for zero information leakage.

      Calculates the upper bound for a 95% confidence interval for a normal distribution with given mean and variance i.e., the value below which 97.5% of sample take.
      static double upperBoundNormal95Upper(double mean, double variance)
      Calculates the upper bound for a 95% confidence interval for a normal distribution with given mean and variance, lower only i.e., the value below which 95% of sample take.

    • Field Detail

      • chiSquareValues95

        public static double[] chiSquareValues95
        χ-squared distribution. chiSquareValues95[i] is the 95% value for the χ-square distribution with i+1 degrees of freedom.

    • Method Detail

      • chiSqu95Interval

        public static double chiSqu95Interval(int freedom)
        Returns the upper bound for the 95% confidence interval for the χ-squared distribution with n degrees of freedom.
        Parameters:
        freedom - freedom
        Returns:
        the upper bound for the 95% confidence interval
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If freedom ≤ 0

      • lowerBoundNormal95

        public static double lowerBoundNormal95(double mean,
                                        double variance)
        Calculates the lower bound for a 95% confidence interval for a normal distribution with given mean and variance i.e., the value above which 97.5% of sample take.
        Parameters:
        mean - mean
        variance - variance
        Returns:
        the lower bound for a 95% confidence interval

      • lowerBoundNormal95Lower

        public static double lowerBoundNormal95Lower(double mean,
                                             double variance)
        Calculates the lower bound for a 95% confidence interval for a normal distribution with given mean and variance, upper only i.e., the value above which 95% of sample take.
        Parameters:
        mean - mean
        variance - variance
        Returns:
        the lower bound for a (upper) 95% confidence interval

      • sdtDevSampled

        Calculates the standard deviation for sampled data.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the standard deviation for sampled data

      • sdtDevSampled

        public static double sdtDevSampled(double[] data,
                                   double sum)
        Calculates the standard deviation for sampled data, using:
        s = sqrt( (Sigma_i (x_i - x)^2) / (n-1) )
        Parameters:
        data - sampled data
        sum - summation of the data
        Returns:
        standard deviation for sampled data

      • upperBoundForZero

        public static double upperBoundForZero(int freedom,
                                       int sampleSize)
        Calculates the upper bound for zero information leakage.
        Parameters:
        freedom - freedom
        sampleSize - the number of samples
        Returns:
        upper bound for zero leakage

      • upperBoundNormal95

        public static double upperBoundNormal95(double mean,
                                        double variance)
        Calculates the upper bound for a 95% confidence interval for a normal distribution with given mean and variance i.e., the value below which 97.5% of sample take.
        Parameters:
        mean - mean
        variance - variance
        Returns:
        the upper bound for a 95% confidence interval

      • upperBoundNormal95Upper

        public static double upperBoundNormal95Upper(double mean,
                                             double variance)
        Calculates the upper bound for a 95% confidence interval for a normal distribution with given mean and variance, lower only i.e., the value below which 95% of sample take.
        Parameters:
        mean - mean
        variance - variance
        Returns:
        the upper bound for a (lower) 95% confidence interval
